intro: Anemia hirsuta var. integrifolia, commonly known as the hairy anemia or smooth-leaved anemia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, violet-colored flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a distinctive species within its genus.
